alert.note: Alert for Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 2:04PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is occurring. Lakes and rivers will continue to rise in the coming days and weeks. * WHERE...Rivers and lakes within the Rainy River Basin including Lake Vermilion, Crane Lake, Namakan Lake, Kabetogama Lake and Rainy Lake and Rainy River. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT Wednesday May 18. * IMPACTS...Strong lake level rises are on going. Many lakes in the warned area still have substantial ice. High water and moving ice due to strong winds can cause impacts to shoreline infrastructure. Flooding continues on area rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 159 PM CDT, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - Levels on Namakan and Rainy lakes are expected to rise 8 to 13 inches between May 10th and May 20th. - Areas affected include Rainer, Island View, Voyageurs National Park, Crane Lake and Lake Vermilion. - http://www.weather.gov/dlh/RainyRiverBasin
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
